entry.title: The South Gloucestershire and Stroud College (Government) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the first provisions of the instrument providing for its constitution and the articles of government for the South Gloucestershire and Stroud College further education corporation.

entry.title: The Goods Vehicles (Testing) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Goods Vehicles (Testing) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 to provide for the introduction of a new system of issuing large trailers with individual logging numbers for type approval purposes. They substitute regulation 6(g)(i) and (ii) to provide that a trailer must be affixed with an identification mark, issued by either the Department of the Environment or the Secretary of State for Transport, before it is accepted for testing.

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Banning Orders) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Rules prescribe the procedure for applications under the Justice Act (Northern Ireland) 2011 (2011 C.24 (N.I.)) relating to banning orders. A banning order, which may only be made on conviction, prohibits a person from entering any premises for the purpose of attending regulated matches. Specifically,

entry.title: The Crown Court (Amendment No. 2) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Rules make a number of amendments to the Crown Court Rules (Northern Ireland) 1979 (S.R. 1979 No.90) (“the principal Rules”) which take account of the amendments made to Article 9 of the Criminal Evidence (Northern Ireland) Order 1999 (“the 1999 Order”) (special provisions relating to child witnesses) by the Justice Act (Northern Ireland) 2011. Specifically,

entry.title: The Occupational Pensions (Revaluation) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order, which corresponds to an Order (S.I. 2011/2867) made by the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions under paragraph 2(1) of Schedule 3 to the Pension Schemes Act 1993, specifies appropriate revaluation percentages. The percentages specified are relevant to the revaluation of benefits under occupational pension schemes, as required by section 80 of, and Schedule 2 to, the Pension Schemes (Northern Ireland) Act 1993. The lower revaluation percentage introduced by the Pensions (No. 2) Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (c. 13 (N.I.)) does not apply to pensionable service before 6th April 2009.

entry.title: The County Court (Amendment No. 3) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Rules make a number of amendments the County Court Rules (Northern Ireland) 1981 (S.R 1981 No.225) (“the principal Rules”) which take account of the amendments made to Article 9 of the Criminal Evidence (Northern Ireland) Order 1999 (“the 1999 Order”) (‘special measures relating to child witnesses’) by the Justice Act (Northern Ireland) 2011. Specifically,

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Amendment No. 2) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Rules make a number of amendments to the Magistrates’ Courts Rules (Northern Ireland) 1984 (S.R. 1984 No.225) (“the principal Rules”) to allow for:

entry.title: The Criminal Appeal (Prosecution Appeals) (Banning Orders) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Rules prescribe the procedures which apply in the Court of Appeal in relation to prosecution appeals under section 43 of the Justice Act (Northern Ireland) 2011 (“the 2011 Act”).

entry.title: The Social Security Pensions (Flat Rate Introduction Year) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order is made under section 122(1) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 (c.4), which allows for the flat rate introduction year, for the purposes of calculating additional state pension, to be designated by order. This Order designates the flat rate introduction year as the tax year beginning 6th April 2012.

entry.title: The Wildlife and Natural Environment (Scotland) Act 2011 (Commencement No. 2) Amendment Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order amends an error in the Wildlife and Natural Environment (Scotland) Act 2011 (Commencement No. 2) Order, with the effect that section 13 (snares) of the Wildlife and Natural Environment (Scotland) Act 2011 comes into force on 1 January 2013 so far as not already in force on that date.

entry.title: The Winchester and Eastleigh Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Dissolution) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order provides for the dissolution on 9th January 2012 of the Winchester and Eastleigh Healthcare National Health Service Trust established on 1st November 1993 and revokes the Winchester and Eastleigh Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Order 1993 that established the trust.

entry.title: The Immigration (Designation of Travel Bans) (Amendment No. 7) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order amends the Schedule to the Immigration (Designation of Travel Bans) Order 2000.

entry.title: The Health Service Branded Medicines (Control of Prices and Supply of Information) Amendment Regulations 2011

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES
HEALTH AND PERSONAL SOCIAL SERVICES, NORTHERN IRELAND

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES
HEALTH AND PERSONAL SOCIAL SERVICES, NORTHERN IRELAND

entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply to the United Kingdom, amend regulation 2 of the Health Service Branded Medicines (Control of Prices and Supply of Information) (No.2) Regulations 2008 (“the 2008 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Investment Trusts (Dividends) (Optional Treatment as Interest Distributions) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Investment Trusts (Dividends) (Optional Treatment as Interest Distributions) Regulations 2009 (S.I. 2009/2034) (“the 2009 Regulations”) which enable an investment trust or prospective investment trust (i.e. a company that expects to be approved as an investment trust) to treat its dividends as payments of interest rather than as dividends on shares for tax purposes.

entry.title: The Wireless Telegraphy (Exemption) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Wireless Telegraphy (Exemption) Regulations 2003 (S.I. 2003/74, as amended) (“the Principal Regulations”) to widen the classes of wireless telegraphy apparatus whose establishment, installation and use are exempted from the requirement to be licensed under section 8(1) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 2006 (c.36).

entry.title: The Wireless Telegraphy (Intelligent Transport Systems) (Exemption) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations exempt the establishment, installation and use of wireless telegraphy stations or wireless telegraphy apparatus within the frequency band 5875 MHz to 5905 MHz complying with certain terms, provisions and limitations, from the requirement to be licensed under section 8(1) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 2006 (c.36).

entry.title: The Protection of the Euro against Counterfeiting (Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to the enforcement of Council Regulation (EC) No. 1338/2001, as amended by Council Regulation (EC) No. 44/2009.

entry.title: The Parole Board Rules 2011
entry.summary: These Rules set out the procedure to be adopted by the Parole Board when dealing with cases referred to it by the Secretary of State.

entry.title: The NHS Foundation Trusts (Trust Funds: Appointment of Trustees) Amendment Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order amends the NHS Foundation Trusts (Trust Funds: Appointment of Trustees) Order 2007 (the “Appointment Order”), which provides for the appointment of trustees by the Appointments Commission for the NHS foundation trusts specified in the Schedules, to hold property for the purposes of the NHS foundation trust for which the trustees are appointed or for any other purpose relating to the health service.

entry.title: The MARD Regulations 2011
entry.summary: Council Directive 2010/24/EU (“MARD”) is about mutual assistance between EU member States for the recovery of claims relating to taxes, duties and other specified measures. The Finance Act 2011 (c. 11), Schedule 25 makes provision for giving effect to that directive.
